title: COVID-19 Vaccinations
cleaned_text: COVID-19 vaccinations are open to everyone in Massachusetts 6 months of age and older. Contact Information Jump To: All people aged 6 months and older are now eligible for the COVID-19 vaccine, and people 5 years and older are eligible for COVID-19 boosters. COVID-19 vaccines are free for everyone, no matter your immigration or health insurance status. Please note that all minors 15 years or younger old must be accompanied by a parent or guardian, and all minors 16-17 years old must have parental/guardian permission. If you need help accessing a COVID-19 vaccine, including help with transportation or language interpretation, please call 311 (617-666-3311). COVID-19 Booster Doses Boosters have been approved for all people aged 5 years and up. People ages 5 years and older are recommended to receive one updated Pfizer or Moderna (bivalent) booster. This includes people who have received all primary series doses and people who have previously received one or more original (monovalent) boosters. Please consult this CDC guide on boosters for more information about what booster you are eligible for and when. Where to Get a COVID-19 Vaccine or Booster - Visit Your Local Pharmacy - Somerville area pharmacies including Walgreens, CVS, Stop & Shop are providing both COVID-19 vaccinations and booster shots. - To find out which vaccines are offered, any site specific restrictions, and to make an appointment, search here: [vaxfinder.mass.gov/?zip_or_city=somerville&search_type=boosters&q=](/vaxfinder.mass.gov/?zip_or_city=somerville&search_type=boosters&q) - Check with your primary care provider - Cambridge Health Alliance (CHA) and Mass General Brigham have vaccine sites in Somerville. - Mass General Brigham patients can sign up on the [Patient Gateway](https://www.massgeneralbrigham.org/en/patient-care/patient-visitor-information/covid-19/vaccine). - CHA offers both community clinic and pharmacy vaccine locations. Community clinics are open to the public with no ID required. - Mass General Brigham patients can sign up on the - Cambridge Health Alliance (CHA) and Mass General Brigham have vaccine sites in Somerville. - Click on "City Vaccination Clinics & Events" in the menu above to see upcoming vaccination clinics. - Search for vaccination sites anywhere in MA at [vaxfinder.mass.gov](http://vaxfinder.mass.gov/)or call 211. [Sign up for City of Somerville vaccine alerts](http://form.jotform.com/210208073769052)to get the latest local information and learn when mobile vaccine clinics are coming to your neighborhood. Need assistance? Call 311 (617-666-3311). City staff are available to help those who face barriers to accessing vaccines including needing transportation or language assistance. When can I get vaccinated? COVID-19 vaccinations are open to everyone in Massachusetts 6 months of age and older Where can I get vaccinated? [Local Pharmacies](https://vaxfinder.mass.gov/?zip_or_city=&q=somerville&p_checked=on) - Walk-in appointments available as supply allows. Pre-registration is recommended. Check with your local pharmacy for pharmacy hours. - Check with your primary care provider. CHA and Mass General Brigham have vaccine sites in Somerville. CHA patients should call the CHA vaccine hotline at (617) 665-1995 or sign up on [MyChart](https://mychart.challiance.org/mychart/Authentication/Login?)for an appointment. Mass General Brigham patients can sign up on the [Patient Gateway](https://www.massgeneralbrigham.org/covid19/vaccine). - Search for vaccination sites anywhere in MA at [vaxfinder.mass.gov](http://vaxfinder.mass.gov/)or call 211 [Sign up for City of Somerville vaccine alerts](http://form.jotform.com/210208073769052)to get the latest local information and learn when mobile vaccine clinics are coming to your neighborhood. Where to Get a COVID-19 Booster People age 5 and older who completed their primary series at least 5 months ago (2 months for Johnson & Johnson's Janssen vaccine) are eligible for a booster dose. People age 50 and older, or age 12 and older with underlying medical conditions, are eligible for a second booster dose at least 4 months after their first booster dose. To get a booster shot, you can: - Visit [vaxfinder.mass.gov](https://vaxfinder.mass.gov/?zip_or_city=&search_boosters=on&q=)and select "Booster Dose" to search for vaccine booster locations in the state of Massachusetts - Call 2-1-1 to find a location convenient to you. Language Interpretation is available. For more information, visit the Massachusetts Department of Public Health [COVID-19 Booster FAQ](https://www.mass.gov/info-details/covid-19-booster-frequently-asked-questions). Need assistance? Call 311 (617-666-3311). City staff are available to help those who face barriers to accessing vaccines including needing transportation or language assistance. Stay informed about the COVID-19 vaccine rollout in Somerville by signing up for [vaccine alerts.](http://form.jotform.com/210208073769052) Through the alert system, the City of Somerville will notify residents when, where, and how to get vaccinated according to the vaccine phases determined by the Massachusetts Department of Public Health. You can also stay informed by checking this website ( [somervillema.gov/covidvaccine](/covidvaccine)) and [mass.gov/vaccine](http://mass.gov/vaccine). You can learn more about the vaccine by visiting the "Videos and Resources" tab to hear from local health care experts discussing common questions and concerns about the vaccine. Where can I get more information? How to get the latest vaccine information: - Vaccination information is changing quickly. If you want the latest news and information on appointment availability, here's where to look: - The State's website: visit [mass.gov/covidvaccine](http://mass.gov/covidvaccine). You can search for the vaccine sites and appointment availability statewide at [vaxfinder.mass.gov](http://vaxfinder.mass.gov). - The City of Somerville website: Visit [somervillema.gov/covidvaccine](/covidvaccine)(this page) for vaccine updates, info sessions, and FAQs. - Call the City's Vaccine Info Lines: Call one of the lines below to listen to the latest update in your language: - English Vaccine Info Line: [617-591-3251](tel:617-591-3251) - Spanish Vaccine Info Line: [617-591-3252](tel:617-591-3252) - Portuguese Vaccine Info Line: [617-591-3253](tel:617-591-3253) - Haitian Creole Vaccine Info Line: [617-591-3254](tel:617-591-3254) - Nepali Vaccine Info Line: [617-591-3255](tel:617-591-3255) - English Vaccine Info Line: - The State's website: visit - Sign up to receive occasional phone calls updating you on the latest COVID-19 vaccine information, including where and how to get a vaccine. To subscribe, visit [somervillema.gov/covidvaccine](/covidvaccine), and select "Sign Up to Receive COVID-19 Vaccine Information and City Alerts", or call 311. If you are already signed up to receive email and text notifications through the City's alert system you will also get this information. Again, this for people who would prefer to get vaccine updates via phone call. Your primary care physician or health provider may also have guidance for you about when and how to get the vaccine, and opportunities to learn more about the COVID-19 vaccine. Resources Videos Learn more about the COVID-19 vaccine from local health care professionals and hear from the experiences of Somerville community members who have been vaccinated. You can view all videos on the [Somerville GovTV YouTube Channel](https://www.youtube.com/user/SomervilleCityTV/videos).
